perl.logFile.description: If set, log output is written to the given logfile, instead of displaying it in the vscode output pane. Log output is always appended so you are responsible for rotating the file.

perl.sshPort.description: optional, port for ssh to remote system

perl.sshCmd.description: defaults to ssh on unix and plink on windows

perl.sshWorkspaceRoot.description: path of the workspace root on remote system

perl.containerCmd.description: If set Perl::LanguageServer can run inside a container. Options are: 'docker', 'docker-compose', 'kubectl'

perl.containerArgs.description: arguments for containerCmd. Varies depending on containerCmd.

perl.containerMode.description: To start a new container, set to 'run', to execute inside an existing container set to 'exec'. Note: kubectl only supports 'exec'

perl.containerName.description: Image to start or container to exec inside or pod to use

perl.env.description: object with environment settings for command that starts the LanguageServer, e.g. can be used to set KUBECONFIG.

perl.pathMap.description: mapping of local to remote paths

perl.perlInc.description: array with paths to add to perl library path. This setting is used by the syntax checker and for the debuggee and also for the LanguageServer itself. perl.perlInc should be absolute paths.

perl.fileFilter.description: array for filtering perl file, defaults to *.pm|*.pl

perl.cacheDir.description: directory for caching of parsed symbols, if the directory does not exists, it will be created, defaults to ${workspace}/.vscode/perl-lang. This should be one unqiue directory per project and an absolute path.

perl.showLocalVars.description: if true, show also local variables in symbol view

perl.disableCache.description: if true, the LanguageServer will not cache the result of parsing source files on disk, so it can be used within readonly directories

perl.debugAdapterPort.description: port to use for connection between vscode and debug adapter inside Perl::LanguageServer. On a multi user system every user must use a different port.

perl.debugAdapterPortRange.description: if debugAdapterPort is in use try ports from debugAdapterPort to debugAdapterPort + debugAdapterPortRange. Default 100.

program.description: Absolute path to perl file that should be debugged.

args.description: optional, array with arguments for perl program.

reloadModules.description: Automatically reload changed Perl modules while debugging.
